title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro played in net for Bruins after Joonas Korpisalo was pulled due to injury against Columbus.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm chose to rest Jeremy Swayman after his Olympic gold win to face Columbus.
DiPietro saved two shots during his 6:03 on the ice, helping Boston maintain a lead and secure the win.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, was arrested for the reckless second-degree murder of her infant found in Pine Island Pond.
The infant, referred to as Baby Jane Doe, was discovered dead in Manchester, N.H., on March 27, 2025.
Authorities received over 50 leads and offered a $5,000 reward during the investigation, which is still ongoing.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, advises against transmission flush if there are no shifting issues with the car.
Repair costs for a 2019 Subaru Crosstrek include $890 for TPMS sensors and $725 for control arm bushings.
A slight drop in antifreeze in a 2018 GMC Denali 1500 may just result from evaporation rather than a leak.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated as roof showed structural stress due to heavy snow accumulation.
Students and staff were relocated to Hingham High School for safety and continued their day there.
Hingham saw over 17 inches of snow from a recent blizzard, prompting contracted roofing specialists to assist.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz previously criticized Rafael Devers for poor defense and fitness issues leading to his trade from the Red Sox.
Ortiz expressed support and admiration for Devers in a recent podcast, emphasizing respect and lessons learned.
Devers' refusal to change positions amid injuries led to tensions and his move to the Giants in 2025.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A natural gas leak caused an explosion that destroyed a Taunton home, injuring two residents, including a 25-year-old mother and her 2-year-old child.
The explosion displaced eight residents, heavily damaged neighboring homes, and is under investigation with assistance from Eversource and state officials.
Community fundraisers raised over $33,000 for the injured family and thousands more for other affected residents as of Thursday night.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 teams in 2026 NFLPA report card, an improvement from 31st in 2025.
Report highlights poor travel resources, including a bottom-ranked team plane with outdated conditions and lack of Wi-Fi.
Patriots' new facility opening in 2026 promises improvements; team ownership grade improved from D to B-.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, 54, a Malden teacher and coach, was arraigned on charges including two counts of rape of a foster child.
Marino allegedly assaulted an 18-year-old in his foster care, buying her alcohol before the incident, prosecutors stated.
He was released on $75,000 bail with GPS monitoring, ordered not to contact the victim or leave Massachusetts.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assaulting a driver during a January 3 traffic stop in Springfield.
Charges include one count of assault and battery and one count involving a dangerous weapon, per court documents.
Daoust was suspended without pay; he had prior disciplinary actions in 2015 and 2017, State Police reported.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey announces rollout of AI assistant, ChatGPT, in Massachusetts executive branch staff.
65% of over 100 surveyed Massachusetts readers oppose state's use of ChatGPT, citing security and environmental concerns.
Healey plans phases for AI introduction, starting with the Executive Office of Technology Services and Security.
